summary.Title: Senior Port Specialist
summary.Presentation: Requisition ID: 26072 Location(s): Aarhus N, Region Midtjylland, DK - Hamburg, HH, DE - Arnhem, GE, NL - London, Greater London, GB - København S, Regi

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Requisition ID: 26072

Location(s): Aarhus N, Region Midtjylland, DK - Hamburg, HH, DE - Arnhem, GE, NL - London, Greater London, GB - København S, Region Hovedstaden, DK

Work experience: Management

Type of position: Full-Time

Does large infrastructure projects and such marine structures as ports and harbors sound exciting and familiar to you? Have you got experience in port contracting process and project management? Take a chance to be a part of our Global Construction Sales/Bid Management Team to #powerthesolutions together bringing the business on the next level.

Sales - Global Construction Management - Global Construction Sales/Bid Management

The Global Construction Sales/Bid Management team is responsible for supporting the Regions with all construction-related activities during the sales phase from early engagement, during bidding and negotiation until hand-over to Construction upon effective closure of a contract. Besides coordinating the construction proposal and associated budget, team deals with the commercial and technical aspects of ports, equipment, vessels, offshore site conditions and aviation services.

The main focus of the team is to support the Regions during their ramp-up and during peak loads, while looking ahead the team will supervise in the adaption/development of processes and governance across the Regions.

Responsibilities

Supervise and support port governance from a Vestas Global Construction perspective towards the regions and e.g., covering the below non-exhaustive topics:

  • Support the implementation of a global Vestas port contract policy in partnership with Global Procurement and Legal, Risk & Compliance departments
  • Support / coordinate the development of port lease contractual frameworks and contracting process development for the regions
  • Implementation of best practices relative to port selection, crane and transport setup, and contracting across the regions
  • Give input to regional identification and evaluations of potential ports / terminal operators for offshore wind projects in the existing and new markets
  • Engage with lawyers and authorities for the purpose of receiving relevant law / regulatory information existing or planned for the regions supported by Global Construction
  • Support commercial and contractual negotiations for short or long-term harbor leases / contracts in the regions in close co-operation with Global Procurement and Legal, Risk & Compliance departments
  • Engage with external stakeholders, clients, engineering consultancies, embassies etc., in the regions supported by Global Construction for the purpose of securing early demands / requirements
  • Participate in port audits, harbor visits, qualification meetings, support to preparation, and submission of RFQ's, proposal evaluations, risk evaluation etc., for regions supported by Global Construction
  • Serve as a lead for other engineering professionals in Global Construction Sales/Bid Management team

Qualifications

  • Commercial or Project Management education combined with legal / contractual / negotiation experience
  • 5+ years of experience in the Marine/Harbor engineering sector
  • 3+ years of experience in the Project Management
  • IPMA certification is desired - level D or C
  • Experience with oversize, over-dimensional cargo (i.e. Wind Turbine Generators)
  • Established network of global port/terminal operators
  • Fluent in English, verbal and written
  • Experienced user of ERP systems, for example SAP

Competencies

  • Solid skills in understanding and interpreting organizations and their setup
  • Significant interpersonal, collaboration, cultural and social understanding / skills
  • Ideal coordinating / planning skills
  • Open to work around the people or colleagues of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds
  • Being flexible in the matter of the working time, and due to the business trips, expected travelling: +30 days/per year
  • Ability to work with limited supervision in an often busy and occasionally inhomogeneous environment
  • Open minded and humorous
  • Positive attitude and approaches to tasks, colleagues and customers

What we offer:

We offer an exciting job with great opportunities for professional and personal development in an inspiring, progressive, motivated and international work environment.

You will join a team of colleagues that values initiative, accountability and focuses on implementing Vestas' processes and governance across the regions from a global level.

Additional information:

You will be working in the one of our offices in the chosen locations: Denmark, Germany, Netherlands, UK.

We are open for candidates from all over the world, who are willing to relocate to one of above location.

Expected travelling days: +30 days/per year.

Please apply no later than 10th of May 2022 by clicking the button "Send ansøgning".

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.


Denne jobannonce blev oprindeligt opslået på https://www.ofir.dk/
(Den originale annonce kan ses på: https://www.ofir.dk/showojob?ofirid=71066b77)
